The ODI is a member of the eduroam federation, an international federated network. This service allows members of the organisation to access the network at other participating sites using their organisational credentials. It also allows guests from participating sites to access the network at the Open Data Institute using their existing credentials.

  • More details on eduroam
  • UK locations with eduroam
  • Worldwide locations with eduroam

Availability

eduroam network coverage is available throughout The Open Data Institute wherever there is wireless.

Configuration

ODI staff

Staff at the ODI should visit the eduroam dashboard and log in using your ODI account. Then, click on "Manage Account", and set an eduroam password.

You can then connect to the eduroam wifi network using the password you just set and the username "yourusername@eduroam.theodi.org".

For help setting up eduroam on your computer you can search for guides that are updated by many Universities. On OS X you will need to accept our certificate popup in order to connect. If you are having issues with your network preferences then a guide to removing eduroam can be found here. This guide will also help you tidy up wireless preferences if you have connected to many networks!

Visitors

The Open Data Institute does not support visitors directly and they should refer to their own institutional settings about how to connect to eduroam.

Terms and Conditions

ODI staff

All staff of the ODI are eligible to use the eduroam network.

Visitors

Visitors to the ODI must abide by normal fair usage policies. The ODI reserves the right to revoke access for anyone found to maliciously abuse this service.

Troubleshooting

If you have any concerns about the service, please email eduroam@theodi.org
